ANDS-Grants.description: Signal processing is an enabling technology for multi-billion dollar industries including broadband connections, medical imaging devices and automotive collision avoidance systems. A key component is real-time optimisation. While various aspects of real-time optimisation have been studied extensively, especially under the banner of adaptive signal processing, the general (non-adaptive) problem will be studied here from a geometric viewpoint. Morse theory and other tools from differential topology will be used to understand the inherent complexity of real-time optimisation problems and to develop novel numerical algorithms for classes of real-time optimisation problems having widespread applicability.
ANDS-Grants.title: Discovery Projects - Grant ID: DP140103163

ANDS-Grants.description: This project will use advanced computing methods applied to electrical brain wave recordings to track how the brain changes as a person undergoes general anaesthesia during surgery. This will lead to better anaesthesia monitoring devices and reduce the chances of people experiencing pain during surgery or IQ deficits after the anaesthesia.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP120200773

ANDS-Grants.description: Southern Innovation develops and markets world-leading pulse processing technologies for the rapid, accurate detection and measurement of radiation. The underlying real-time signal processing challenge relates to isolating often overlapping pulses, determining when each pulse arrived and the energy of each pulse. Recent advances in the computational power of digital signal processing boards makes it timely to develop innovative pulse processing algorithms based on optimal filtering of stochastic processes. These algorithms will have widespread impact, both commercially for minerals exploration, materials analysis, medical imaging and security screening, and scientifically for improving the performance of the syncrotron and other equipment.
ANDS-Grants.title: Linkage Projects - Grant ID: LP140100473
subjects: PULSE PROCESSING; PULSE PROCESSING; RADIATION DETECTION; RADIATION DETECTION; SIGNAL PROCESSING; SIGNAL PROCESSING; SIGNAL PROCESSING
